newsitem.title: CANADA: Philip sees meeting Q2, 1997 forecasts.
newsitem.headline: Philip sees meeting Q2, 1997 forecasts.

text.p: Philip Environmental Inc Chief Executive Allen Fracassi said on Thursday that he expected profit at the waste management company to meet analysts' forecasts in the second quarter and full-year 1997.
Consensus earnings per share estimates for Philip, according to International Brokers' Estimate System were C$0.25 (US$0.18) in the second quarter and C$1.12 (US$0.81) for the full year.

The Hamilton, Ontario-based company on Wednesday reported softer than expected first-quarter earnings of US$0.16 a share, which Fracassi said included a US$0.02 gain from the sale of USA Waste Services Inc shares. Analysts had forecast US$0.16 a share earnings without the gain.

"We remain very, very comfortable with consensus for Q2 as well as consensus for the year, even if we exclude the two cents from the gains of USA Waste shares," Fracassi told analysts in a conference call.
Philip's first-quarter revenues rose to US$269.6 million from year earlier US$113.4 million, benefiting from its acquisitions of Allwaste Inc and Serv-Tech Inc.
"The Allwaste and Serv Tech merger and integration program is going quite well," Fracassi added.
Philip shares fell 3.80 to 17.80 in Toronto today, topping net losers. They lost 2-5/8 to 12-7/8 on the New York Stock Exchange.
